results.title: God knows why, but it works
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Richard Mason and Phil Noyce
results.brief_description: The story of the life and work of Dr. Archie Kalokerinos. In nineteen years’ practice as the only doctor in the tiny western New South Wales town of Collarenebri, he has formulated radical treatments to combat the alarming health problems of the district’s Aboriginal population. This dramatised version of his life stars Henry Szeps, Robin Nevin and Peter Cummins.

results.title: God bless mummy and make her good
results.creator_credit: ICEM, National Association for Maternal and Child Welfare, George Howe and Sarah Erulkar
results.brief_description: The homes of ordinary families are visited in order to record the natural reactions of the parents and their children in their own environment, doing the things they do every day. Intended to provoke parents into thinking about their relationships with their children.

results.title: God's girls: stories from an australian convent
results.creator_credit: Central Park Films, Glenys Rowe and Cherie Nowlan
results.brief_description: A group of nuns, past and present, talk about life in a Sisters of Mercy convent in Singleton, N.S.W. from the 1940’s to the present day. This is a courageous and clever film that investigates the subtle complexities of change within a society that has been surrounded by mystery for hundreds of years. The film delves deeply into the beliefs of those women who have chosen to live a very different life to that of most women, but it also gives voice, with integrity, wit and sensitivity to those who have chosen to leave the cloister. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: Goblin market
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Belinda Hall, Megan Harding and Rachel Perkins
results.brief_description:
“Morning and evening
maids heard the goblin cry,
come buy our orchid fruits
come buy, come buy”
Goblin market by Christina Rossetti
Adapted from the poem by Christina Rosette about an age-old myth as seen through contemporary Australian eyes.
Cast: Rachel Maza (Laura), Lisa Maza (Lizzie)

results.title: Goats
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film in which the physical appearance and behaviour patterns of a herd of goats are studied. Individual details are featured in close-up. Aspects of goat behaviour are also shown, from the gentle grazing on leaves to the aggressive head-butting of the males. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Goals for the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Considers such topics as family breakdown, violence and vandalism, and alienation in youth.

results.title: Go, sober and safe
results.creator_credit: Highway Safety Films and Earl Deems
results.brief_description: More than 50% of all traffic deaths in the USA are caused by drinking drivers. How people are actually affected by alcohol depends very much on body weight, amount of food in the stomach and length of time over which the alcohol was consumed. Diagramatically the film explains how alcohol works and shows a test worked out to show how alcohol affects driving ability.

results.title: Go West
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and Edward Buzzell
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers go to America’s wild west where the man who gets the deed to Dead Man’s Gulch gets rich. Groucho, Chico and Harpo go west in search of the deed. Filled with typical Marx Brothers’ lunacy, “Go West” climaxes with the wildest train chase on film. Cast also includes John Carroll, Diana lewis, Walter Woolf King, Robert Barrat.
